intro: Acrostichum lonchophyllum, commonly known as the broadleaf hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found near water bodies. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine and as a ornamental plant.
